00026 // The requirements for a bare-bones vector class:
00027 //
00028 //
00029 //   o) must have 0-based [] indexing for const and
00030 //          non-const objects  (i.e. operator[] defined)
00031 //
00032 //   o) must have size() method to denote the number of
00033 //          elements
00034 //   o) must clean up after itself when destructed
00035 //          (i.e. no memory leaks)
00036 //
00037 //   -) must have begin() and end() methods  (The begin()
00038 //          method is necessary, because relying on 
00039 //          &v_[0] may not work on a empty vector (i.e. v_ is NULL.)
00040 //
00041 //   o) must be templated
00042 //   o) must have X::value_type defined to be the types of elements
00043 //   o) must have X::X(const &x) copy constructor (by *value*)
00044 //   o) must have X::X(int N) constructor to N-length vector
00045 //          (NOTE: this constructor need *NOT* initalize elements)
00046 //
00047 //   -) must have X::X(int N, T scalar) constructor to initalize
00048 //          elements to value of "scalar".
00049 //
00050 //       ( removed, because valarray<> class uses (scalar, N)  rather
00051 //              than (N, scalar) )
00052 //   -) must have X::X(int N, const T* scalars) constructor to copy from
00053 //              any C linear array
00054 //
00055 //         ( removed, because of same reverse order of valarray<> )
00056 //
00057 //   o) must have assignment A=B, by value
00058 //
00059 //  NOTE: this class is *NOT* meant to be derived from,
00060 //  so its methods (particularly indexing) need not be
00061 //  declared virtual.
00062 //
00063 //
00064 //  Some things it *DOES NOT* need to do are
00065 //
00066 //  o) bounds checking
00067 //  o) array referencing (e.g. reference counting)
00068 //  o) support () indexing
00069 //  o) I/O 
00070 //
